response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Valid Triangle\", \"description\": \"Given the lengths of three sides of a triangle, determine if it's valid or not. A triangle is valid if the sum of the lengths of any two sides is greater than the length of the third side.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef is_valid_triangle(a: int, b: int, c: int) -> bool:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `a` (int), `b` (int), and `c` (int): The lengths of three sides of a triangle.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns `True` if the input triangle is valid, `False` otherwise.\", \"code\": \"def is_valid_triangle(a: int, b: int, c: int) -> bool:\\n    return a + b > c and a + c > b and b + c > a,\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert is_valid_triangle(5, 3, 2) == True\", \"assert is_valid_triangle(1, 2, 3) == False\", \"assert is_valid_triangle(10, 7, 6) == True\"] }"
